questions.question: What does a yellow diamond-shaped sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Yellow diamond-shaped signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming road conditions and hazards.

questions.question: What does a red octagon sign mean?
questions.explanation: A red octagon sign is universally recognized as a stop sign.

questions.question: What does a green traffic light indicate?
questions.explanation: A green light means you can proceed if the intersection is clear.

questions.question: What does a flashing red traffic light mean?
questions.explanation: A flashing red light has the same meaning as a stop sign.

questions.question: When are you allowed to pass another vehicle on the right?
options: If the vehicle is making a left turn
If the vehicle is making a right turn
questions.correctAnswer: If the vehicle is making a left turn
questions.explanation: You may pass a vehicle on the right if it is making a left turn, and there is room to pass safely.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in a school zone when children are present in West Virginia?
questions.explanation: The speed limit in a school zone when children are present in West Virginia is 15 mph.

questions.question: When can you park in front of a driveway?
options: If the driveway is not in use
If you are only parking for a short time
If you have a disabled placard
questions.explanation: It is illegal to park in front of a driveway.

questions.question: When should you use your headlights?
options: When visibility is reduced due to weather
When driving on country roads at night
questions.explanation: Headlights should be used between sunset and sunrise, in poor visibility conditions, and on country roads at night.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on the highway?
options: Park with part of your vehicle on the highway
Move your vehicle off the traveled part of the highway if possible
questions.correctAnswer: Move your vehicle off the traveled part of the highway if possible
questions.explanation: If your vehicle breaks down, you should move it as far off the road as possible.

questions.question: What should you do if you're driving and a dust storm starts to reduce your visibility?
options: Keep driving at the same speed
Pull over and turn off your lights
Increase your speed to get out of the storm
questions.correctAnswer: Pull over and turn off your lights
questions.explanation: If a dust storm reduces visibility, pull over safely, turn off your lights, and wait until the storm passes.
